meanings.definition: To make something look like an antique.
meanings.sent1: She antiqued the mirror to make it look old and elegant.
meanings.sent2: The furniture was antiqued to match the vintage style of the room.
meanings.sent3: He antiqued the new dresser, turning it into a piece that seemed to have a story to tell.
meanings.sent4: Her skills antiqued the plain vase, transforming it into a treasure from the past.
meanings.sent5: The artist antiqued the frame, adding a touch of history to the modern painting.

meanings.definition: Having the appearance of an antique.
meanings.sent1: The antiqued chest in the corner added a touch of old-world charm to the room.
meanings.sent2: She loved the antiqued look of the vintage jewelry she found at the flea market.
meanings.sent3: The antiqued clock on the mantel seemed to tick to the rhythm of a bygone era.
meanings.sent4: His antiqued desk held secrets of the past within its worn drawers.
meanings.sent5: The antiqued finish on the table gave it a sense of history and character.

meanings.definition: To give an antique appearance to something.
meanings.sent1: They antiqued the picture frame to match the vintage photograph inside.
meanings.sent2: Antiquing the bookshelf transformed it into a piece that looked like it belonged in a museum.
meanings.sent3: She antiqued the lamp, making it seem like a relic from a forgotten time.
meanings.sent4: The artist antiqued the statue, bringing out its ancient beauty.
meanings.sent5: Antiquing the mirror frame added a touch of elegance to the room.
